In EVA mode with a Kerbal, just go ahead and press "r"! To control, ijkl and hn are your translational keys, and wasd is normal movement. A few caveats: Make sure you have EVAfuel on your kerbal and also make sure that the local gravity is weak enough to use the EVA pack. Those thrusters have kick, but they aren't that powerful!

 

I hope this helps, and welcome to the fray!

Edited May 17, 2018 by Gyrfalcon5

It's an RCS jetpack, so yes, R to activate the RCS.

When you are flying suborbital, except in special circumstances, the game forces your helmet to point Up. In space, except in special circumstances, the game forces your helmet to always point North. The default setting is for your Kerbal to always be forced to point directly away from your camera viewpoint. So you can turn your Kerbal by moving the camera. You enable and disable that mode by turning SAS on and off. To force your Kerbal to face away from you, hit space. If you are in space and point your camera nearly South or North, and then hit space to try to force your Kerbal to face in that direction, your Kerbal will go temporarily insane.

Shift to thrust up (towards your helmet), Ctrl to thrust down. W is forward, S is backward. A is left, D is right. Q and E rotate, but you will almost never use those two.
